issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [NSFW] [https://sugirl.info/video/45203/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsugirl.info%2Fvideo%2F45203%2F) ### Comment > This issue is caused by Adguard on iPhone's inability to handle iframes properly. There is no specific rule in place to hide the ad placeholder. On PC, blocking the script reduces the size to 0, effectively hiding the ad frame. However, on iPhone, the iframe remains visible, which is why it's expected that the ad frame does not disappear. If there are any other reasons contributing to this behavior, please let me know for future reference. ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/glousjammw0gk080ww8sso8w0s48ss8sbi8qyw6les.jpg?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.3 DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

comment.body:
I see ads only if I disable AdGuard.
I suppose that the problem might be that HTTPS filtering doesn't work on this website for some reason, but I'm just guessing.

@grwthomps Could you please add this rule:
```adblock
imdb.com##body
```
to user rules.
Whole content of this website should be hidden, it's just for test purpose to check if HTTPS filtering and element hiding rules work correctly.

pull_request.title: Bump markdownlint from 0.33.0 to 0.34.0
pull_request.body:
Bumps [markdownlint](https://github.com/DavidAnson/markdownlint) from 0.33.0 to 0.34.0.
Changelog

Sourced from markdownlint's changelog.

0.34.0

  • Use micromark in MD027/MD028/MD036/MD040/MD041/MD046/MD048
  • Improve MD013/MD034/MD049/MD050/MD051
  • Update custom rule requirements and documentation
  • Improve various TypeScript declarations
  • Update dependencies
Commits
  • b2305ef Update to version 0.34.0.
  • 6920d8c Bump typescript from 5.4.2 to 5.4.3
  • 8fe819f Bump webpack from 5.90.3 to 5.91.0 in /micromark
  • 53f4bbf Bump webpack from 5.90.3 to 5.91.0
  • 4c7cc9c Add 2 missing trailing semicolons.
  • ab0ea70 Update test repo snapshots.
  • c83afe1 Update documentation for MD013/line-length to call out a missing scenario and...
  • 82441fa Reimplement MD036/no-emphasis-as-heading using micromark tokens.
  • 6f6348a Bump @microsoft/api-extractor from 7.42.3 to 7.43.0 in /micromark
  • a83e2d8 Reimplement MD041/first-line-heading/first-line-h1 using micromark tokens.
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=markdownlint&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=0.33.0&new-version=0.34.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons  share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances  pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Closes #175401

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

comment.body:
> Ok, thanks for checking!

hello alex sorry but it seems like I made a mistake i was running a vpn while i was trying your solution this morning but when i disabled it the ads starting to come out again but with no time restrictions for 120 sec like this screenshot

  ![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/22161118/7309a3f8-2bf9-44ea-9bf0-21b015894946) 
  
  but like this one 

![Untitled](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/22161118/ed4b4e91-5508-4608-a6e4-b41dadd36d66)

it's look like the ads has injected in the mp4 file because i downloaded it (no audio for piracy protection) and the ads downloaded with it locally like this 

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/22161118/418559e9-ae3b-418a-bf64-701064b6466d)

the real video is displaying but it's time is increased by the time of ads like this

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/22161118/ec77586d-1ec6-4c5c-a6cb-961e2a6c7961)


then i decided to make deep testing 

and tried this (with two vpns***two times for each) with and without this new filter enabled or disabled in filters editor from (base filter) (i removed the user filter after base filter updated and found the filter and disabled it) then the wonder thing the ads just vanished even if i have disabled this filter.
i think it's an egyption global ip list related thing for pishing ads for just this list of my country

when getting back from virtual network i get the ads again just like any condition of the filter enable or disable (photo 1,2 )

please give me your advice for it to solve and if the har file is useful for it take a look

sorry for this long explain and hope iam not buzzring you

thanks in advance

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.title: uttranews.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock professional company.
Ad-Shield receives up to 700 000 000 KRW per 2 year from tech foundation support program of South Korean government.

These records can be verified at [here](https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues?q=label%3Aad-shield+).
You can check the fact that support of South Korean government at [here](https://www.venturesquare.net/857777).

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [microShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://community.list-kr.com/docs/AdGuard/Userscripts/microShield.

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/issues).
Please report to [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/175385) if other issue.

### Issue URL (Ads) [NSFW] [https://sugirl.info/video/45203/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsugirl.info%2Fvideo%2F45203%2F) ### Comment > This issue is caused by Adguard on iPhone's inability to handle iframes properly. There is no specific rule in place to hide the ad placeholder. On PC, blocking the script reduces the size to 0, effectively hiding the ad frame. However, on iPhone, the iframe remains visible, which is why it's expected that the ad frame does not disappear. If there are any other reasons contributing to this behavior, please let me know for future reference. ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/glousjammw0gk080ww8sso8w0s48ss8sbi8qyw6les.jpg?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.3 DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:

comment.body:
Hey Adguard Team!

	I have down everything that youve mentioned for me to do, and yet the problem is persistent. Even after refreshing, or on every other site, I see a massive number of ads and pop-ups that are simply annoying and a pain to not click click on it by mistake. I thought using Adguard for Safari would fix the problem, but no avail. I hope youd be able to help in any ways possible.

Thank you


> On 20 Mar 2024, at 15:59, Alex ***@***.***> wrote:
> 
> 
> @RahulDhage6 <https://github.com/RahulDhage6> Hi. Did you try to refresh the page? Do you see ads on another sites, where ads were blocked?
> 
> Also please try to disable-enable content blockers in Safari settings and restart Safari, and check for filters update.
> 
>

comment.body:
Na co konkretnie ustawione s opcje `Self-destructing third-party cookies` (`Samoniszczce ciasteczka firm trzecich`) `Self-destructing first-party cookies` (`Samoniszczce ciasteczka firm pierwszych (niezalecane)`)?
Jeli na `0`, to prawdopodobnie to powoduje ten problem i polecam to zmieni.
Jak na inn warto, to sprawd prosz, czy problem wystpuje po wyczeniu `trybu niewidzialnoci`.

W zgoszeniu tego nie ma, ale jeli wczony jest `Filtr elementw szpiegujcych AdGuard`, to prawdopodobnie jest to zwizane z tym bdem - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardBrowserExtension/issues/2552

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

comment.body:
> Now I can't reproduce the problem again

The problematic rule was disabled.

issue.title: Error in Safari
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Safari ### AdGuard version latest ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? apkmirror ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I saw the issue and found that there was a problem with the adshield in apkmirror. So, after checking the adshield domain, I checked that popup filter works differently in safari. I made an exception to the shield pop-up filter and it worked well. When I turned on the adguard, the domain request seems to be blocked. In safari, I think we need to block the pop-up in another way. So there was no problem with Chrome and firefox, but I think it was a problem because the filter worked differently in Safari. Filters that are only problematic in Safari 2. Screenshots

comment.body:
Logs show nothing was blocked.

See attached screenshot.

I have, in the past (before the current installation of the app) spent time
going through every single request the Gmail app makes, copying the IP
address (there is a lot that Google uses) and manually going and creating
whitelist rules for every one of them.

When I have done that, the items in the screenshot would be highlighted
green, instead of the no highlight that they have now.

It still didn't fix the problem though.

I would open up an email from usps, none of the images would load, and I
would go to the logging and every single request was showing highlighted
green.

Even here, none are highlighted red, and nothing should be blocked. But it
doesn't display correctly the images unless I set Gmail to not filter
through ad blocker.

-Joe

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Bug
labels.description: The issue is caused by a program bug

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

comment.body:
> > Now I can't reproduce the problem again
> 
> The problematic rule was disabled.

I [asked](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/172033#issuecomment-2011759598) him to add the rule. BTW, though we certainly don't want to break the site, we can't get any feedback as the rule was disabled. Anyway no point in leaving the JS rule alone, as it is meant to fix the error caused by the disabled rule.

comment.body:
Following up, as a test I completely uninstalled adguard for mac and the adguard assistant extension for Safari. Then I installed just the adguard for safari browser extension **without** adguard for mac or adguard assistant. It seems to block ads within Safari better than adguard for mac with adguard assistant (with https filtering **off** that is). 

Am I understanding correctly that the benefit of adguard for mac is that it blocks things outside of Safari, has dns filtering, and provides a little more blocking with https filtering enabled? 

Since https filtering causes me some issues and I primarily care about blocking ads within Safari, I might just use the basic adguard for safari extension rather than turning https filtering on/off.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.twitch.tv/thunny](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.twitch.tv%2Fthunny) ### Comment > Das Problem kann umgangen werden in dem in dem Stream rechts die lila Krone bzw. das rechts angezeigte berlagerte Icon angeklickt wird und das "Sichtbar" abgewhlt wird. > Es tritt in Zusammenhang mit der integrierten TwitchOverlay Erweiterung u.a. "Slay the Relics reborn" und auch "Prime Gaming benefits Reminder" aus. Siehe Screenshot. > > Bei den Einstellung des Icons (Icon anklicken) muss das "Sichtbar" abgewhlt werden damit der Stream normal dargestellt wird. comment.body:
When I removed the filtering through adguard, it started pinging specific
IPs through TCP, traffic that isn't even attempted when filtered through
AdGuard. (See attachment one)

Now it's started showing some Gmail traffic blocked (attachment two), but I
don't know why -- I have ci3.googleusercontent.com whitelisted (you can see
it highlighted green), but it's also blocking it (you can see it
highlighted red). It wasn't showing any red highlights before, so maybe
this will help track it down.

-Joe

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Safari ### AdGuard version latest ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? apkmirror ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I saw the issue and found that there was a problem with the adshield in apkmirror. So, after checking the adshield domain, I checked that popup filter works differently in safari. I made an exception to the shield pop-up filter and it worked well. When I turned on the adguard, the domain request seems to be blocked. In safari, I think we need to block the pop-up in another way. So there was no problem with Chrome and firefox, but I think it was a problem because the filter worked differently in Safari. Filters that are only problematic in Safari 2. Screenshots
User rules

Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? apkmirror ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. I saw the issue and found that there was a problem with the adshield in apkmirror. So, after checking the adshield domain, I checked that popup filter works differently in safari. I made an exception to the shield pop-up filter and it worked well. When I turned on the adguard, the domain request seems to be blocked. In safari, I think we need to block the pop-up in another way. So there was no problem with Chrome and firefox, but I think it was a problem because the filter worked differently in Safari. Filters that are only problematic in Safari 2. Screenshots
